summary: DOD has increasingly relied upon Special Operations Forces since 9/11. The number of personnel has jumped from 45,000 to 70,000 and the budget for Special Operations Command has more than doubled. Congress recently directed DOD to improve its oversight of special operations. We found DOD faces two key challenges in improving oversight: It has not set timeframes for taking planned actions It has not clearly...
title: Special Operations Forces: Additional Actions Are Needed to Effectively Expand Management Oversight
